title: Sales at Britain's Asda deteriorate further, down 4.7 pct
text:

Tue, Aug 18, 2015, 13:52 BST - UK Markets close in 2 hrs 38 mins Sales at Britain's Asda deteriorate further, down 4.7 pct Reuters - UK Focus â€“ 1 hour 11 minutes ago -0.023 
(Adds CEO quotes) 
LONDON, Aug 18 (Reuters) - Sales at Wal-Mart's British supermarket Asda slumped 4.7 percent in the second-quarter, as the laggard in the industry failed to get to grips with a fierce price war brought on by discount retailers. 
Asda, which trails UK market leader Tesco (Xetra: 852647 - news ) by annual revenue and is battling with Sainsbury (Amsterdam: SJ6.AS - news ) 's to be Britain's No. 2 grocer, said sales at stores open over a year deteriorated in the 11 weeks to June 30, its fiscal second quarter. 
The 4.7 percent drop compared to a fall of 3.9 percent in the first quarter, which was its worst decline in over five years. 
The slump in sales at Asda, which mainly trades from large out-of-town stores, increases pressure on Chief Executive Andy Clarke (Toronto: CKI.TO - news ) , whose strategy of cutting prices has not yet delivered a corresponding lift in sales volumes. 
"We've certainly hit our nadir," he told reporters on Tuesday, added that he had seen some green shoots of growth in the third quarter. "I'm here to stay," he said. 
The sales and profits of the big four, which also includes Morrisons, have been dented by a fierce price war sparked by the lower prices at discounters Aldi and Lidl. They have also been hurt by falls in food prices, reflecting record commodity-led deflation. 
(Reporting by James davey, writing by Paul Sandle; editing by Kate Holton)
